newsitem.title: USA: Summit Medical Systems sees Q4 loss.
newsitem.headline: Summit Medical Systems sees Q4 loss.

text.p: Summit Medical Systems Inc said Thursday that anticipated revenue for the fourth quarter will result in a loss for the quarter.
The healthcare information services company said it believed new product releases scheduled for the first quarter of 1997 caused potential customers to delay purchase decisions in the fourth quarter.
The company reported a loss of $0.92 a share in the fourth quarter of 1995.

In addition, Summit Medical's consolidated fourth quarter results will include operating results for C.L. McIntosh & Associates Inc, as well as non-recurring charges related to the previously announced acquisition of C.L. McIntosh and the buyout of the company's Cordillera LLC joint venture from Duke University and three physicians at the university.
Summit officials were not available to explain the charges more thoroughly.
Summit shares closed down 3/8 at 7-1/4 Thursday.
